data.title: Story of a Poor Young Man (1942 film)
data.text:
1942 Argentine film

Story of a Poor Young ManDirected byLuis Bayón HerreraWritten byStarringCinematographyRoque FunesEdited byJosé CardellaMusic byAlejandro Gutiérrez del Barrio

Production

company

Release date

Running time

98 minutesCountryArgentinaLanguageSpanish

Story of a Poor Young Man (Spanish:La novela de un joven pobre) is a 1942 Argentine historical drama film directed by Luis Bayón Herrera and starring Hugo del Carril, Santiago Gómez Cou and Nélida Bilbao. It is based on the 1858 French novel of the same title by Octave Feuillet, which was later adapted again in 1968.[1] The film's sets were designed by Juan Manuel Concado. It was released during what is considered to be the Golden Age of Argentine Cinema.

Synopsis

[edit]

In the 1850s a young man returns to his family home in Buenos Aires to discover that his father is financially ruined.
